intro: Aspidogyne costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and has elliptical, opposite leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
